tournament.name: Tuesday 2nd Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: This Bant Control deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with spells like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to play powerful threats such as Dream Trawler and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes plenty of counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust to disrupt the opponent's game plan, along with board wipes like Shatter the Sky to deal with threats. Planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World provide additional utility and card advantage, while Elspeth Conquers Death serves as removal. The deck aims to control the game and overpower the opponent with its powerful threats.

This Bant Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to control the battlefield and generate card advantage. The deck also includes efficient threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Dream Trawler to stabilize the board and apply pressure. With counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust, along with removal spells like Shatter the Sky, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own board presence. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and powerful threats.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the game through various spells and creatures. The deck focuses on establishing board control with cards like Deafening Clarion and Cavalier of Flame, while also utilizing Planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Haktos the Unscarred and Kenrith, the Returned King provide additional threats to pressure the opponent. The deck aims to stall the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful spells and creatures.

This deck is focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and sacrificing synergies. It aims to control the board with cards like Mayhem Devil and Priest of Forgotten Gods, while also generating card advantage with Midnight Reaper. Using Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven, the deck can create a loop of sacrificing and bringing back creatures, gaining incremental advantage. Claim the Firstborn can disrupt the opponent's board state, and the mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility. Overall, the deck is designed to be fast-paced and relentless in its attacks.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce their life total to zero. The deck focuses on playing creatures like Fervent Champion and Robber of the Rich early on to start dealing damage, while also using burn spells like Shock and Embercleave to remove any blockers and finish off the opponent. Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Anax, Hardened in the Forge are key cards that increase the damage output of the deck, making it a dangerous threat in the early game.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures with flash and counter spells to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. By utilizing cheap counter spells like Negate and Quench, along with efficient creatures like Nightpack Ambusher and Brineborn Cutthroat, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building a board presence. Nissa, Who Shakes the World provides ramp and additional threats, with Fabled Passage and Growth Spiral ensuring consistent mana production. The deck aims to out tempo the opponent and finish the game quickly with aggressive creature beats.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counter spells and removal while maintaining card advantage through cards like Growth Spiral and Chemister's Insight. The deck aims to create a steady mana base with Wilderness Reclamation and take advantage of its instant-speed spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional card advantage and life gain, while Nightpack Ambusher gives the deck a potent threat to close out the game. Overall, the deck focuses on outlasting opponents and eventually overwhelming them with powerful spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing the adventure mechanic to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. By combining adventure creatures with cards like Lucky Clover and Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck aims to generate value and maintain card advantage throughout the game. Escape to the Wilds provides additional card draw and ramp potential, allowing for explosive turns. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands to ensure smooth consistency in casting spells of different colors. Overall, the strategy revolves around tempo and board control to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. It also includes removal spells like Time Wipe and Elspeth Conquers Death to deal with threats. The deck aims to ramp up its mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to cast big threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. It also includes counter spells like Aether Gust and Mystical Dispute to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through control and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through powerful creatures like Dream Trawler, Hydroid Krasis, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, as well as utilizing instant and sorcery spells like Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Growth Spiral and Elspeth Conquers Death to help ramp up mana and deal with threats efficiently. The planeswalkers Teferi, Time Raveler, Tamiyo, Collector of Tales, and Nissa, Who Shakes the World provide additional control and card advantage to keep the opponent at bay.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Dream Trawler, while also utilizing removal spells such as Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death to deal with threats. The deck also includes card draw and ramp spells like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to ensure consistent resources and mana advantage. Teferi, Time Raveler acts as a disruptive element, allowing the player to dictate the pace of the game. This deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of control and card advantage.

The key concept of this Bant Control deck is to utilize powerful control cards and strong late-game threats to outvalue opponents and control the game. By ramping with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, the deck aims to stabilize the board and then deploy powerful threats like Dream Trawler and Hydroid Krasis to take over the game. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage engines, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a strong board presence and close out the game efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis to generate card advantage and sustain. It also includes efficient removal spells like Shatter the Sky and counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust to control the board. The deck aims to stabilize the board, control the game, and eventually win with powerful threats like Dream Trawler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World.

This deck focuses on playing a control strategy by utilizing various counterspells, board wipes, and powerful planeswalkers to control the game. The deck also includes powerful finishers such as Dream Trawler and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure access to all colors necessary to cast the spells in the deck. By controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent, this deck aims to secure victory through incremental advantage.

This control deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, allowing the player to establish board control and dominate the late game. With a mix of powerful creatures like Dream Trawler and Cavalier of Flame, along with disruptive spells like Deafening Clarion and Aether Gust, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption while Kenrith, the Returned King offers versatility and a potential win condition. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy threats onto the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's game plan. By sacrificing creatures to Witch's Oven and Priest of Forgotten Gods, players can generate value with cards like Mayhem Devil and Midnight Reaper. Additionally, Claim the Firstborn allows for stealing opposing creatures and dealing damage with them. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, utilizing sacrifice synergies to gain incremental advantages and close out games efficiently.

The deck focuses on an aggressive Rakdos strategy that utilizes sacrifice and recursion mechanics. It aims to consistently deal damage to the opponent by sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and utilizing Mayhem Devil triggers. Claim the Firstborn is used to steal the opponent's creatures and further the aggressive game plan. Woe Strider and Priest of Forgotten Gods provide additional sacrifice outlets and card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating incremental advantage through sacrificing and recurring creatures. Castle Locthwain and Midnight Reaper help to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Dreadhorde Butcher and Gutterbones, while also utilizing sacrifice effects from cards like Mayhem Devil and Priest of Forgotten Gods to gain advantage and disrupt the opponent's board. Additionally, the deck has a strong synergy between Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven to generate value and gain incremental advantage. The overall strategy of the deck is to maintain a fast and relentless assault on the opponent while controlling the battlefield through sacrifice effects and card draw.

The deck focuses on maintaining constant pressure on the opponent by using creatures with powerful abilities such as Dreadhorde Butcher and Mayhem Devil. It also utilizes sacrifice synergies with cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Woe Strider to generate value and control the board. Additionally, the combo of Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven provides a recurring source of damage. Claim the Firstborn is used to disrupt the opponent's board state, while cards like Midnight Reaper and Rix Maadi Reveler help with card advantage and keeping the aggression going.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing efficient mana acceleration and card advantage from cards like Light Up the Stage. The key strategy is to establish board presence early with creatures like Anax, Hardened in the Forge and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell, then finish off the opponent with powerful combat tricks like Embercleave. Castle Embereth also provides additional damage output, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and turn the game in the deck's favor.
